column3: When I was adding the logic for sequence locks we decided it was not worth calculating those for wallet txs, primarily because it was near impossible to have a non-final transaction in your wallet (since you would never have accepted it to your mempool).  Perhaps out of scope for this PR, but I think we should consider whether we want to support any notion of finality in the wallet at all.  These

>  we decided it was not worth calculating those for wallet txs, primarily because it was near impossible to have a non-final transaction in your wallet\n\nThis is true at the moment. Although non-final handling may make sense when the GUI, some day, allows producing transactions that are not final yet. But maybe they could just be flagged some way to keep them from being considered for balance
If `fOnlyConfirmed` is false, `IsTrusted()` is not executed at all. Is this OK?\n
Yes. Your right, was deluded by the OR further down.\nI just removed that part.\n
